snippet.title: Pluto and its moon Charon have something that doesn't exist anywhere else in the solar system
snippet.content:
NASA's New Horizons spacecraft for the first time in July 2015. Scientists are astonished by the incredible features they have observed on the dwarf planet, including a 1,000 mile wide region covered in nitrogen snow . But we have reason to believe Pluto's heart is a bit warmer than the ice the covers it.
Produced by Alex Kuzoian
